Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 09:49PM sweetbadger wrote: I have a question ladies, I keep hearing about compression bras, or wearing a sports bra after the bandages come off but I don't remember my PS mentioning anything like this to me.  We took off the bandages today and I am wearing a cami that has the pockets to hold the drains in.  Am I missing something here?  Should I contact the after hours call center and ask?  I just don't want to mess up with my TE's... any advice? Thanks, Christine
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: May 4, 2011 05:53AM sweetbadger wrote: Carabear, how long after surgery did you have to wait before getting your first fill?  I just got my first two drains removed today so I am quite pleased, I go back on Thursday and who knows, maybe I will get lucky and get the last two removed!  I hate taking all he meds, but am thankful for them all the same.  I can feel the pain starting to kick back in about 3.5 hours after taking them.  I woke up from my BMX with 350cc to start with so that was rather surprising.  Hang in there girls, we can do this
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 07:21PM - edited Apr 30, 2011 07:26PM by sweetbadger I too have been having the chest spasms.  It is kind of like a flutter, or like when i was pregnant and the baby had hiccups?  Very weird.  So we took off the bandages today and had a shower, I was surprised to have as much "shape" as i do.  Also was shocked when my PS said she was able to get 350cc in left TE and 300cc in right.  I feel pretty good today, 3 days post-op.  Took a nice walk outside with hubby and the fresh air and walk has helped to get things moving again, that and the prune juice lol.
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 11:56PM sweetbadger wrote: Thank you Michelle, I too am short waisted so i feel like everything is all smashed up around me.  thanks again for responding to me.  It's hard to know what is supposed to be "normal" right now.
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: May 4, 2011 11:30PM sweetbadger wrote: Melanna: I had surgery 4/27 and still have not gotten path report yet.  I was wondering the same thing, how do "clean margins" work with us MX girls?  We go see the PS again tomorrow, doubt i will get the last two drains out because i'm still putting out about 20 ml of fluid per side/8 hours.  Won't miss these stinking things uggggg.  My cancer side is way more sore than the "good" side.  So my questions for her tomorrow so far: What size are my TE?  and How long till we start fills.  I picked up some Bio-Oil at the store today, heard it is helpful for scars and stretch marks.  Oh and I also want to pick up Silicone strips, I guess they help with fading of scars as well, i guess more questions for her: When can i start using these products? I can tell right now, we will have to practice patience in the days to come... love, Badger
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 08:46PM sweetbadger wrote: Did some gardening this weekend too, it felt so good to be able to pull a few weeds and enjoy a bit of sun.  Here in Oregon sun is a big deal lol.  I behaved and didn't lift the heavy stuff.  Get a fill tomorrow so I'm glad I was able to enjoy a fairly pain free weekend before hand.  Not sure about the swimming Randi, ask your PS.  Would hate to "undo" any of the hard work they are doing to put us back together Hope everyone had a lovely 3 day weekend C
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2011 03:01PM - edited Jun 7, 2011 03:04PM by sweetbadger Shannon:My DH got me a "grandma weeder"  one that works like a shovel of sorts so it isn't a strain on the upper body.  Mostly I pulled the "easy" weeds by hand, and  didn't lift any heavy buckets.  I found just being in the dirt and flowers helped my mood tremendously!  In fact I should follow my own advice and get back out there.  Kinda feeling blue, the TE are getting HEAVY and are taking on an "iron torture bra" kind of feel lol.  CONTRATS on being cancer free!!!!  I am about 5 weeks post BMX and got the clean bill of health from the oncologist last week.  The last couple months have been insane and I am still kind of reeling. love you ladies, have a wonderful day! Christine
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 08:17PM sweetbadger wrote: Allison: thanks for the feed back, We meet with the PS for my first post-op apt tomorrow morning so I will be interested to see what she has to say in regards to bras and also how soon can I get these dang tubes out!  As far as I have heard I don't have to have any radiation, but I guess it will depend on the pathology report.  I'm sorry to hear that you have to do more treatments, but at this point it is better to be safe than sorry.  My thoughts and prayers are with you and your family. Christine

Christine
